inference:
Since the angles of a quadrilateral add up to $360^{\circ}$, we have

$$160^{\circ}+2x=360^{\circ}\Rightarrow2x=360^{\circ}-160^{\circ}\Rightarrow x=\frac{360^{\circ}-160^{\circ}}{2}=100^{\circ}.$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$100$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The angles around a point sum to $360^\circ$, so $x^\circ + x^\circ + 160^\circ = 360^\circ$.  Simplifying gives $2x^\circ + 160^\circ = 360^\circ$, so $2x^\circ = 200^\circ$ and $x=\boxed{100}$.
